com.paydiant.android.core.facade

Class SecurityManagerFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paydiant.android.core.facade.SDKLoggingProvider
      • com.paydiant.android.core.facade.SecurityManagerFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISecurityManagerFacade

    public class SecurityManagerFacade
extends SDKLoggingProvider
implements ISecurityManagerFacade
    The Class SecurityManagerFacade. Implementation class for the security manager facade.
    Author:
    Paydiant Inc.

      Constructor for SecurityManagerFacade Initializes the facade with the required SecurityManagerService , deviceManagerService and hostContext.

      This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates user credentials and logs in the user.
      String loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
      This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates the user using the PIN and logs in the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecurityManagerFacade

        public SecurityManagerFacade(ISecurityManagerService securityManagerService,
                     IDeviceManagerService deviceManagerService)
        Constructor for SecurityManagerFacade Initializes the facade with the required SecurityManagerService , deviceManagerService and hostContext. All login methods requires an instance of IDeviceManagerService, So use this constructor when invoking any login methods. logout() and deleteDevice(DeleteDevice) methods can use any of the constructors.
        Parameters:
        securityManagerService - - instance of the securityManagerService.
        deviceManagerService - - instance of deviceManagerService

      • SecurityManagerFacade

        public SecurityManagerFacade(ISecurityManagerService securityManagerService)
        Instantiates a new security manager facade.
        Note: All login methods require an instance of IDeviceManagerService, therefore use SecurityManagerFacade(ISecurityManagerService, IDeviceManagerService) to create an instance for invoking any login methods. logout() and deleteDevice(DeleteDevice) can use any of the constructors.
        Parameters:
        securityManagerService - the security manager service

    • Method Detail

      • loginByUserName

        public String loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates user credentials and logs in the user.
        Specified by:
        loginByUserName in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - instance of DeviceSecurityProfile which encapsulates both the user credentials and device information.
        Returns:
        Returns true of login is successful and false if login fails or if the MFA is prompted the mfa question will be returned .

      • loginWithPin

        public String loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates the user using the PIN and logs in the user.
        Specified by:
        loginWithPin in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - instance of DeviceSecurityProfile which encapsulates both the user credentials (PIN) and device information.
        Returns:
        Returns true of login is successful or false if login fails.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logout.
        Specified by:
        logout in interface ISecurityManagerFacade

      • deleteDevice

        public boolean deleteDevice(DeleteDevice device)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Delete device.
        Specified by:
        deleteDevice in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        device - the device
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • getAdditionalAttributes

        public Map<String,String> getAdditionalAttributes()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Returns any additional information related to the user device/login which returned after a successful ISecurityManagerFacade.loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile) or ISecurityManagerFacade.loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile) call. This may include the additional information such as the last login date, last login status, force password change etc. This would return null, if there aren't any additional information available.
        Specified by:
        getAdditionalAttributes in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Returns:
        A key-value map containing the additional information related to the user device/login, if available, or null.
        See Also:
        DeviceFingerprint.getAdditionalAttributes(), ISecurityManagerFacade.loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile), ISecurityManagerFacade.loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • loginByNonce

        public DeviceSecurityProfile loginByNonce(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Logs in the user using a nonce. Returned response's DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus() property will contain whether the login was successful (LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS, failed ( LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS or MFA answer required (LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED. If status is ( LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED, then this method will need to be called again with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.setQuestionAndAnswer(com.paydiant.android.core.domain.QuestionAndAnswer) properties populated.
        Specified by:
        loginByNonce in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - Initial call will require nonce and device properties populated. To provide MFA answers, use the returned DeviceSecurityProfile with questionAndAnswer properties populated.
        Returns:
        the device security profile response with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus()
        See Also:
        ISecurityManagerService.getDeviceFingerprintTemplateByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile), ISecurityManagerService.loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • loginByFederatedIdentity

        public DeviceSecurityProfile loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Logs in the user using the information retrieved from identity service provider. Returned response's DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus() property will contain whether the login was successful ( LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS, failed (LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS or MFA answer required ( LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED. If status is (LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED, then this method will need to be called again with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.setQuestionAndAnswer(com.paydiant.android.core.domain.QuestionAndAnswer) properties populated.
        Specified by:
        loginByFederatedIdentity in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - Initial call will require authorizationCode, identityProvider and device properties populated. To provide MFA answers, use the returned DeviceSecurityProfile with questionAndAnswer properties populated.
        Returns:
        the device security profile response with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus()
        See Also:
        ISecurityManagerService.getDeviceFingerprintTemplateByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile), ISecurityManagerService.loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • isAuthorizationTokenExist

        public boolean isAuthorizationTokenExist()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Checks whether the long lived session is enabled or not.
        Specified by:
        isAuthorizationTokenExist in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Returns:
        true if long lived session enabled (i.e. Device authentication token generated.)

      • generateDeviceAuthToken

        public DeviceSecurityProfile generateDeviceAuthToken(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Generates a device authentication token for long lived sessions.
        Specified by:
        generateDeviceAuthToken in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - DeviceSecurityProfile object containing the UserCredentials object's username & password properties populated.
        Returns:
        DeviceSecurityProfile with device authentication token populated.

      • loginByDeviceAuthToken

        public boolean loginByDeviceAuthToken()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Logs in using device authentication token parameters
        Specified by:
        loginByDeviceAuthToken in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Returns:
        true if successfully logged in.

      • expireDeviceAuthToken

        public boolean expireDeviceAuthToken()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityManagerFacade
        Expires the long lived session device authentication token.
        Specified by:
        expireDeviceAuthToken in interface ISecurityManagerFacade
        Returns:
        true if the current device authentication token successfully expired.
